channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FLUME-1732] Build is failing due to netty problems
item.description: FLUME-1723 changed how we bring in netty and that seems to have broken the build https://builds.apache.org/job/flume-trunk/330/#showFailuresLink
item.summary: Build is failing due to netty problems

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

I wonder if it's the -U flag. Trying a build with that.
Ugh... I think I found a Maven bug. Verifying again, then I will report it @ Sonatype and look for workarounds.

Looks like a Maven bug to me.

To reproduce:

1. Delete all flume jars from your Maven repo: rm -rf ~/.m2/repository/org/apache
2. Run install build with -U:

mvn clean install -B -U -e -Dtest=TestLog4jAppender,TestPropertiesFileConfigurationProvider,TestRpcClient,TestRpcClientCommunicationFailure,TestLegacyAvroSource -DfailIfNoTests=false

This build will fail with tests complaining about missing dependencies. Even though it says it is installing the locally built modules to the local repository, in reality the artifacts are not there. They are whatever was downloaded from upstream. So these lines, for example, are a lie:

[INFO] --- maven-install-plugin:2.3.1:install (default-install) @ flume-ng-sdk ---
[INFO] Installing /Users/mpercy/src/flume.alt/flume-ng-sdk/target/flume-ng-sdk-1.4.0-SNAPSHOT.jar to /Users/mpercy/.m2/repository/org/apache/flume/flume-ng-sdk/1.4.0-SNAPSHOT/flume-ng-sdk-1.4.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
[INFO] Installing /Users/mpercy/src/flume.alt/flume-ng-sdk/pom.xml to /Users/mpercy/.m2/repository/org/apache/flume/flume-ng-sdk/1.4.0-SNAPSHOT/flume-ng-sdk-1.4.0-SNAPSHOT.pom

because that .pom matches the old one that was downloaded from a few days ago (specifically, it does not contain the netty dependency).

Even weirder, if you simply execute the same command as in the above step, it will go through fine.

3. Run install build with -U:

mvn clean install -B -U -e -Dtest=TestLog4jAppender,TestPropertiesFileConfigurationProvider,TestRpcClient,TestRpcClientCommunicationFailure,TestLegacyAvroSource -DfailIfNoTests=false

Build success!

As one might expect under normal circumstances, now the SNAPSHOT artifacts in the local repository are from the local build (the install message was not a lie).

I wonder if this is related to http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MNG-3282
This bug does not appear to affect release artifacts, so it is not a 1.3.0 blocker, as was pointed out on the dev list.
We actually catch Netty's ChannelException in AvroLegacySource, so we should pull it in anyway. Here is a patch which does that.
This patch alone does not fix the issue btw.
I just filed http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MNG-5383 for this issue.

This is kinda gross but essentially this patch just adds netty as a dep everywhere that this bug is surfaced.

This should only be needed to get past this bug, would be best to remove these deps from anything that doesn't explicitly using netty jars after the SNAPSHOT with these changes gets built and pushed.

Integrated in flume-trunk #352 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/flume-trunk/352/)
FLUME-1732: SpoolableDirectorySource should have configurable support for deleting files it has already completed instead of renaming (Revision 750809c70aa92225ed8df2ded0364d30a220405b)

Result = SUCCESS

Cancelling Patch Available on this JIRA for now, maybe not needed after all.
mpercy Is this still an issue? If not, can we please mark this as resolved, so that it goes out of unresolved list

paliwalashish It appears to still be an issue to me, I have the same issue on my brand new dev environment, and doing as suggested by mpercy in "step 3" of his comment above does results in success for me.

Actually, I have a very similar failure, but not the same cause.

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project flume-ng-core: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.apache.flume:flume-ng-core:jar:1.4.0-SNAPSHOT: Could not find artifact org.apache.flume:flume-ng-sdk:jar:tests:1.4.0-SNAPSHOT in apache.snapshots (http://repository.apache.org/snapshots) -> [Help 1]
org.apache.maven.lifecycle.LifecycleExecutionException: Failed to execute goal on project flume-ng-core: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.apache.flume:flume-ng-core:jar:1.4.0-SNAPSHOT: Could not find artifact org.apache.flume:flume-ng-sdk:jar:tests:1.4.0-SNAPSHOT in apache.snapshots (http://repository.apache.org/snapshots)
And I totally shouldn't have commented on this at all, I wasn't paying attention and was in some old branch from who knows when....

Interestingly it seems like it has been committed:

trunk(964bcf56)$ git log --oneline --grep FLUME-1732
750809c7 FLUME-1732: SpoolableDirectorySource should have configurable support for deleting files it has already completed instead of renaming

Unfortunately this is just a mistake in commit message. That change belongs to FLUME-1731 instead.

I followed mpercy's steps from above but no failure for me. I conclude everything went back to normal since this ticket was opened. So marking this ticket as resolved.
